citations.narrative:
A written program of exercise for dogs that is approved by the attending veterinarian (AV) was not available for inspection.
A written program of exercise for dogs helps ensure dogs will have adequate space. Ensure to work with the AV to
develop and maintain a written exercise plan that is approved by the AV.
***Correct by 6/4/2025

A written program of veterinary care (PVC) that was developed with and signed by the current Attending Veterinary (AV)
was not available for inspection. The licensee has had regularly scheduled visits and review of aspects of care by the AV,
however the written PVC must be developed, signed and approved by the current AV to help ensure that there is
adequate veterinary care for the dogs at the facility. Ensure to work with the current AV to develop, document and
maintain a PVC that is approved and signed by the current AV.

Topper, (Male red poodle #30) has matted hair on his legs and body. Matted hair can cause discomfort and skin problems
in dogs. Ensure that Topper's hair is not matted by taking appropriate coat care steps and ensure routine measures are
taken to prevent any matting of hair in each dog.
***Correct by 5/23/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
A written program of exercise for dogs that is approved by the attending veterinarian (AV) was not available for inspection. 
A written program of exercise for dogs helps ensure dogs will have adequate space. Ensure to work with the AV to 
develop and maintain a written exercise plan that is approved by the AV.  
***Correct by 6/4/2025 
3.13(a)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
A written program of veterinary care (PVC) that was developed with and signed by the current Attending Veterinary (AV) 
was not available for inspection. The licensee has had regularly scheduled visits and review of aspects of care by the AV, 
however the written PVC must be developed, signed and approved by the current AV to help ensure that there is 
adequate veterinary care for the dogs at the facility. Ensure to work with the current AV to develop, document and 
maintain a PVC that is approved and signed by the current AV. 
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Topper, (Male red poodle #30) has matted hair on his legs and body. Matted hair can cause discomfort and skin problems 
in dogs. Ensure that Topper's hair is not matted by taking appropriate coat care steps and ensure routine measures are 
taken to prevent any matting of hair in each dog. 
***Correct by 5/23/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
